intro: Knautia arvensis var. flore-alba, commonly known as the white knautia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, fluffy white to pale pink flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It prefers full sun to partial shade and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
